MS MCQs

    Virtualize resources in the cloud - Virtualization for virtual machines

    »

    1. What is the term used to describe programs that create and manage virtual machines?

      Hyper-V

      Hypervisor

      Hypermanager

      Hyperhost


    2. Given that each virtual machine runs its own guest operating system, can two different operating systems (for example, Linux and Windows) run side by side in two VMs on the same host?

      Yes

      No


    3. True or false? When a VM is rebooted, the host also has to be rebooted.

      True

      False


    4. Which of the following statements is true?

      A system VM can present an ISA different than that of the host system to the applications that it hosts, but a process VM cannot.

      A Java Virtual Machine (JVM) is an example of a system VM.

      A system VM can present four CPU cores to applications running on a two-core processor, while process VMs cannot.

      A single system VM can run on two servers at the same time, while a process VM cannot.
